New Records: South Africa broke their 24-year World Cup jinx against Pakistan with a one-wicket victory.
Key Match Events: Aiden Markram scored a crucial 91 runs.
Usama Mir took 2 wickets for 45 runs as a concussion substitute.
Shaheen Afridi took 3 wickets for 45 runs.
Tabraiz Shamsi was named player of the match.
Keshav Maharaj hit a four to secure the win for South Africa.
Haris Rauf nearly won it for Pakistan with a diving catch.
Saud Shakeel scored 52 runs and Shadab Khan scored 43 runs for Pakistan.
Gerald Coetzee took 2 wickets for 42 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa skipper Bavuma acknowledged the pressure of chasing and the need to address their issues.
Pakistan team director Mickey Arthur warned against a 'witch-hunt' of his team.
Babar Azam expressed disappointment and emphasized the need to perform well in the remaining matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan were ranked as the world's number one ODI team last month.
Pakistan won their first two games of the tournament but then lost four successive matches.
